  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    JMRIInterfaceImplementation()
    Initialisation of one client for each of the JMRI WebServer and the JMRI WiThrottleServer in order to be able to exchange data with them later.

      value - The value that the property should have

    • getTrainOnLayoutBlock

      public org.json.JSONObject getTrainOnLayoutBlock​(String layoutBlockName)
      Description copied from interface: JMRIInterface
      Attempts to identify the train that is currently on the given layout block. If this fails, for example because there currently is no train on that block or for other reasons, null is returned.
      Specified by:
      getTrainOnLayoutBlock in interface JMRIInterface
      Parameters:
      layoutBlockName - The name of the layout block
      Returns:
      The data of the train currently on the layout block as JSONObject; null if no such train can be identified.

    • startLayoutBlockOccupationListenerThread

      private void startLayoutBlockOccupationListenerThread()
      Starts a thread that polls the reporters of all layout blocks at short intervals about their current state so that trains can be identified and located on the track system.

    • addLocomotive

      public void addLocomotive​(String locomotiveReference, String address)
      Description copied from interface: JMRIInterface
      Registers a locomotive for control via the WiThrottle protocol. A repeated, identical call of this method is harmless.
      Specified by:
      addLocomotive in interface JMRIInterface
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled, which is to be used in subsequent method calls (reference)
      address - The DCC address of the locomotive with a distinction for short and long addresses, e.g. "S" for short and "L" for long addresses

    • removeLocomotive

      public void removeLocomotive​(String locomotiveReference)
      Description copied from interface: JMRIInterface

      Specified by:
      removeLocomotive in interface JMRIInterface
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)

    • setFunctionKeyPressed

      public void setFunctionKeyPressed​(String locomotiveReference, int functionKeyNumber, boolean pressed)
      Description copied from interface: JMRIInterface
      Sets a function key as pressed or released
      Specified by:
      setFunctionKeyPressed in interface JMRIInterface
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      functionKeyNumber - The number of the function key, e.g. 1 or 12
      pressed - true if the key is to be set as pressed; false if it is to be set as released

    • setFunctionKeyLocking

      public void setFunctionKeyLocking​(String locomotiveReference, int functionKeyNumber, boolean locking)
      Description copied from interface: JMRIInterface
      Determines whether a certain function key is a so-called 'locking' function key, i.e. whether it should remain pressed by itself after being pressed until it is explicitly released.
      Specified by:
      setFunctionKeyLocking in interface JMRIInterface
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      functionKeyNumber - The number of the function key, e.g. 1 or 12
      locking - true, if the function key is to remain pressed by itself after a press until it is explicitly released again; false, if it is allowed to change to the released state again by itself

    • setMovingDirection

      public void setMovingDirection​(String locomotiveReference, MovingDirection movingDirection)
      Description copied from interface: JMRIInterface
      Sets the direction of travel. The two possible directions of travel are provided by the MovingDirection enum.
      Specified by:
      setMovingDirection in interface JMRIInterface
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      movingDirection - The desired direction of travel that the locomotive should follow after calling this function.

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(String locomotiveReference, int speed)
      Description copied from interface: JMRIInterface
      Sets the speed of the locomotive. The allowed values depend on the hardware used and the settings in JMRI.
      Specified by:
      setSpeed in interface JMRIInterface
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      speed - The speed that the locomotive should have.

    • sendCommand

      private String[] sendCommand​(String... commandStrings)
      Sends a command to the WiThrottle server and receives its response.
      Parameters:
      commandStrings - The strings from which the command is composed
      Returns:
      The (possibly multi-part) response of the server

    • processQueryResults

      private void processQueryResults​(String[] queryResults, String messagePrefix)
      Processes the given (possibly multi-part) response from the server. If information on the direction of travel or speed of a specific locomotive identified by the prefix is included, this information is cached.
      Parameters:
      queryResults - The (possibly multi-part) response from the server
      messagePrefix - A prefix used to identify the locomotive to which information is being received.
